p: In the flu season, the cases of A. baumannii 's infection was greater than those in the non-flu season (15 cases vs. 1 case). It was noteworthy that bacteria such as H. influenzae, B. catarrhalis, S. maltophilia, E. cloacae, K. ornithinolytica, S. marcescens, S. haemolyticus, S. pneumonia were not detected in the non-flu season. The emergence of influenza viruses (Flu A and Flu B) was more common in the flu season, other virus like MPV and 229E were smaller than flu in the influenza season ( Table 4).
